snippet: A new report by the Institute of Medicine explains how hundreds of billions of dollars is spent on unnecessary services and other needless costs.
abstract: Editorial cites Institute of Medicine report that estimates roughly 30 percent of health care spending in 2009, around $750 billion, was wasted on unnecessary or poorly delivered services and costs; holds report makes clear that pilot projects in Affordable Care Act to encourage better coordination of care, make medical prices transparent and accelerate the use of health information technology should be expanded.
lead_paragraph: A new report by the Institute of Medicine explains how hundreds of billions of dollars is spent on unnecessary services and other needless costs.

headline.seo: Waste in the Health Care System
headline.main: Waste in the Health Care System
headline.print_headline: Waste in the Health Care System
